instNote: This church was accidentally destroyed by fire during the war, while used as quarters by Confederate soldiers. It has not been rebuilt as yet, for want of means. The number of Catholics residing here is small, but numbers congregate here in the summer months, because of the famous healing baths of the Berkeley Springs.

It has just lost its pastor, Rev. J. Bixio, S.J., who, by his superiors, has been called to California. This church, till a pastor can be appointed, will be visited monthly, as also Charlottesville, Harrisonburgh, and other stations, by Rev. Mr. Farren, of Lynchburgh.

They are unable to rebuild the church and the house; it is therefore intended, as soon as circumstances will allow, to call on the sympathy and liberality of the Catholics of the North to remove, as soon as possible, these sad vestiges of the late troubles in the country
